title: Sri Lanka to temporarily suspend all normal debt servicing for interim period
body_lines: Sri Lanka will temporarily suspend all normal debt servicing for an interim period, pending an orderly and consensual restructuring of the obligations that are consistent with an International Monetary Fund-supported economic adjustment program, the Ministry of Finance says.
This policy of the government will be applied to amounts of affected debts outstanding on 02 April, 2022, a statement issued by the ministry read.
“New credit facilities, and any amounts disbursed under existing credit facilities, after that date are not subject to this policy and shall be serviced normally.”

The holders of all affected are requested to capitalize any amounts of principal or interest falling due during this interim period, at an interest rate not higher than the normal contractual rate applicable to that credit, until a restructuring proposal can be presented to the creditors for their consideration.
